channel.title: tmux on Today I Learned
channel.description: Recent content in tmux on Today I Learned

item.description: Getting alt-left alt-right working between iTerm2, zsh, vim, tmux. iTerm2, setting the correct key bindings: Preferences -> Profile -> Keys ; Set preset to ‘Natural Text Editing’ zsh, setting and consuming the correct key bindings: Enable zsh-vim-mode vim, overwrite f mapping with w, since f is sent for alt-right: .vimrc add line map f w

Hello World. First! Profiling golang projects # .go file import ( _ "net/http/pprof" ) # bash $ curl -sK -v localhost:30020/debug/pprof/heap > heap.out $ go tool pprof heap.out (pprof) png Generating report in profile001.png (pprof) exit $ go tool pprof -http=:8080 heap.out Output in png requires graphviz (brew install graphviz) Fix tmux configuration issues when upgrading iTerm2 and tmux version 2.9 to 3.1b unbind } ==> unbind "{" unbind { ==> unbind "{" bind \ if '[ ===> bind \\ if '[ Scrolling in iTerm and tmux, fixed by
